chart.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: information that is clearly arranged in the form of a simple picture, set of figures, graph etc, or a piece of paper with this information on it
chart.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a chart showing last year’s sales
chart.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a detailed map, especially of an area of the sea or the stars
chart.translation[0].note_box[0].section: types of charts
the pop charts
Their new single went straight to number 1 in the pop charts.
the singles charts
The song reached number 9 in the singles charts.
the album charts
This put Marley into the album charts for the first time.
the indie charts
The song went straight to the top of the indie charts.
be in the charts
The song was in the charts for weeks.
go into/enter the charts
The album entered the UK charts at number 2.
hit the charts
The group eventually hit the charts.
top the charts/be top of the charts
‘Without You’ topped the British charts for five weeks.
chart + NOUN
a chart hit
At last the band had got a chart hit.
chart success
It looks like they are set for chart success.
number 1/5/15 etc in the charts
In 1962 'Love Me Do' reached only number 17 in the charts.
chart.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to record information about a situation or set of events over a period of time, in order to see how it changes or develops
chart.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Scientists have been charting temperature changes in the oceans.
chart.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to make a plan of what should be done to achieve a particular result
chart.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Each team was responsible for making its own decisions and charting its own course.
chart.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to make a map of an area of land, sea, or stars, or to draw lines on a map to show where you have travelled
chart.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: if a record charts, it enters the weekly list of the most popular records
chart.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a mathematical drawing or list, showing information arranged in a way that is clear and easy to understand
chart.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: European companies account for the remaining 89% of sales - see chart on next page.
chart.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to carefully record information about a situation over a period of time to see how it changes or develops
chart.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: We are collecting large amounts of information on households and companies in order to chart the effects of taxes and benefits.
chart.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: to plan something new in detail
chart.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: a national conference set up to chart a democratic future for the country
